chart.title: Exposure to particulate matter air pollution
chart.subtitle: Population-weighted average level of exposure to concentrations of suspended particles measuring less than 2.5 microns in diameter (PM2.5). Exposure is measured in micrograms of PM2.5 per cubic meter (µg/m³).
chart.note: The [WHO's Air Quality Guidelines](#dod:who-air-quality-guidelines) suggest annual average PM2.5 exposure should be less than 5 µg/m³ in order to minimize the impacts of PM2.5  on human health.
chart.citation: World Health Organization - Global Health Observatory (2025)
